subject: RE: [junit] Junit Design Patterns.
msgSnippet: I m still trying to remember when I had a good experience with Rational Rose! ;-) ArgoUML is no worse than Rose and seems to be steadily improving and it runs
messageBody:
I'm still trying to remember when I had a good experience with Rational Rose! ;-) ArgoUML is no worse than Rose and seems to be steadily improving and it runs pretty slick on my Mac OS X box. :-)

My problem is that no modeling tool yet competes with my whiteboard and coloured markers.

Simon

-----------------------------------------------------------------
Simon P. Chappell simon.chappell@...
Java Programming Specialist www.landsend.com
Lands' End, Inc. (608) 935-4526


>-----Original Message-----
>From: Jason Rogers [mailto:jacaetevha@...]
>Sent: Friday, October 11, 2002 12:05 PM
>To: junit@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: RE: [junit] Junit Design Patterns.
>
>
>Just as an FYI -- I have never had a good experience with this one...
>Neither has anyone whom I know that has used it. Probably
>"user error."
>:)
>
>=jason
>[:question | ^One]
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Mark Meyers [mailto:markm@...]
>Sent: Friday, October 11, 2002 11:10 AM
>To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
>Subject: RE: [junit] Junit Design Patterns.
>
>
>There is an open source alternative:
> http://argouml.tigris.org
>
>it's not as polished as Together, but it is Free and free ;-)
>They have other nice things too, BTW.
>
>> -----Original Message-----
>> From: Dave Astels [mailto:dave@...]

>> To: junit list
>> Subject: Re: [junit] Junit Design Patterns.

>> On Thu, 2002-10-10 at 14:04, Thach Nguyen wrote:
>> > Farenn,
>> >
>> > If you read UML, go to www.togethersoft.com and download their
>> > whiteboard version (free). With this installed, you can
>> feed in junit
>> > java/class files and reverse engineer junit from code to
>> see the design.
>>
>> To my knowledge, TogetherSoft no longer has a free Whiteboard
>> edition.
>> They discontinued that a couple years ago and I haven't heard that
>> they've reinstated it.
>>
